intro: Hibbertia proberae, commonly known as the golden hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red centers. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite and ovate in shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Hibbertia proberae is an attractive species for gardens due to its vibrant blooms and hardy nature.
